byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Reporting was contributed by Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, Malachy Browne from New York, and Sophia Kishkovsky from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Interviews with aid workers, rescuers and residents, along with video and photographic evidence, point to a coordinated attack by Russian or Syrian aircraft, probably both.

headline.print_headline: ‘From Paradise to Hell’: How an Aid Convoy in Syria Was Blown Apart
headline.main: ‘From Paradise to Hell’: How an Aid Convoy in Syria Was Blown Apart

snippet: Interviews with aid workers, rescuers and residents, along with video and photographic evidence, point to a coordinated attack by Russian or Syrian aircraft, probably both....
